text: hello everyone my name is John Soul Solutions architect with AWS in this
video I will discuss how customers can modernize their document workflows using
AWS intelligent document processing Solutions at AWS we built IDP to allow
customers to take advantage of industry-leading machine learning Technologies and their document workflow
without the need for ML experience the foundation is our OCR technology that
has industry leading accuracy from there we are able to use ml to extract
information for popular document types such as forms tables invoices and
contracts our ml also provides you the capability to analyze the documents to
classify them into types such as identification documents or tax forms as
well as recognize entities unique to your business such as driver's license or prescri destion
number one thing to keep in mind when moving to IDP is that the software costs
typically go up compared to Legacy Solutions but the overall costs decrease
as less human input is needed per document and accuracy improves resulting
in fewer bad decisions caused by inaccurate information overall you will
be able to serve customers faster since idp's scalability removes document
process processing as a bottleneck for your business's growth and it is much easier to handle spiky workloads while
not paying for excess capacity during lower periods of demand IDP is used across a variety of
Industries for example in finance IDP is used to extract information from
documents to support know your customer processes process account applications
and obtain credit reports in the medical industry IDP is used to extract
information from prescriptions handle insurance forms and convert handwritten notes to text and in the legal field IDP
is used to handle Discovery documents legal filings and contracts these are
just a few of the ways that IDP helps customers optimize document
processing let's see what a typical IDP pipeline looks like going from left to
right it's starts with capturing documents in S3 are highly durable and scalable Object Store next Amazon text
trct takes the input document and extracts the text Amazon comprehend then
analyzes the text to classify the document according to categories defined by the
customer once the document is classified it is routed for further processing
these routes are defined by the customer's own business rules for example drivers license documents may be
sent to a know your customer workflow that will extract the first name last name and driver's license number or a
medical document may be routed to comprehend medical to identify key Health entities such as medical
conditions medication and treatment or legal contract documents may be sent to
a contract review workflow humans may be part of the document processing pipeline also for
example humans May check any low confidence extraction of text and make Corrections if needed or they may
provide a final check and verification and provide their stamp of approval before sending the documents Downstream
to backend systems so how do customers get
documents into S3 well because S3 is so flexible
customers can store any type of document from scan images and PDFs to word excel
and text files document sources May range from physical mail rooms with
scanners to desktop computers or camera phones or even documents sent through
FTP text messages or emails you may be already familiar with
Tex tracks text and OCR capabilities but we also offer support for handwritten
text as well as the ability to extract more complex structures such as tables
key value pair information and signatures from a wide variety of forms
such as financial statements loan applications insurance claims clinical forms and even offshore drill
documents another capability of textract is specialized document support based on
customer feedback customers told us that they love the accuracy that Tex tracks
generic tables fors and OCR models provide but that they want our help in
deriving additional domain specific inferences for their most valuable documents we have three dedicated apis
to tackle important domain specific use cases the first analyze expense API is
dedicated to the processing of invoices and receipts documents that helps customers automate the process of
processing their accounts payable invoicing expense management and other workflows that have been historically
very difficult to automate the second is analyze ID API which is
dedicated to data extraction from identity documents such as passports driver's license and state IDs issued by
the United States without the need for any templates or configuration the core
use cases for the analyze ID API are identity uh verification online
registration and billing the third is analyze lending API which enables our
customers to efficiently process mortgage documents such as mortgage statements bank statements and payoff
statements another capability is text track queries which is a pre-trained
out-of-the-box AI feature that provides customers the flexibility to specify and
extract the data they need without worrying about the structure of the data across a long taale of diverse documents
formats and versions this is an example of using multiple
tools to extract information from a single document the top row is using the
output from our OCR software without the advanced ml features your developers
would need to create the post processing roles to extract the important business information for your Downstream Business
Systems we have the ability to process both typed and handwritten
information the advanced forms capability is able to identify that the
job fair checkbox was checked but the website was not checked and finally our
tables capability is able to identify the information within the tables while
maintaining the uh key relationship between the columns and the
rows document classification is used when customers have different processing requirements for different types of
documents for example from a bank statement you want to extract the date
the amount and whether it was a credit or debit for each transaction whereas
from a pay stub you want to extract the gross pay the deductions any taxes and
finally the net pay document classification is accomplished in the Amazon comprehend by creating custom
classifiers Training comprehend with a custom classifier is straightforward forward customers simply need to provide
examples of each type of document and provide a category for each type of document comprehend uses multiple
algorithms in the training process and picks the model that delivers highest accuracy for the training data this way
users don't need to deal with the complexities of choosing different algorithms or running iterations and
then determining the best Ensemble of algorithms they simply need to provide training text and comprehend and does
the rest once a model is trained users can reference it by name and run inference
jobs either in real time or asynchronously realtime classification takes only one document and Returns the
result synchronously asynchronous classification can process multiple documents at a time and stores the
results in an S3 bucket Amazon comprehend may be used to
support a variety of use cases es for processing sensitive documents that
contain pii or personal identifiable information comprehend can detect and
optionally redact pii data in the document comprehend Also may be used to
find common entities within the document such as organizations people locations
dates quantities and titles and finally customers can train comprehend to detect
custom entities such as insurance policy numbers product codes or
occupation the goal of IDP is to reduce the amount of human input required to
get accurate information into your decision systems in Prior generation OCR
a human was often required to review all or most information with IDP you are
able to reduce the amount of human input for your document processes many customers plan a multi
step journey to implement the people process and Technology change and their document processing workflows while the
end automation goal is set by your business needs we find that customers who take a phased approach to
implementing automation are able to see both quick wins and reach their long-term goal while the end goal could
be 90% automation starting out with quick in projects that deliver 25 to 50%
labor savings is often the best way to get
started the core services in IDP textract and comprehend are great at
extracting text classifying documents finding entities and more by utilizing
generative Ai and their Foundation models or FMS that are trained on vast
amounts of data the core IDP Services can be augmented with new
capabilities for example the IDP text output may be summarized by FMS to help
readers focus on important points or the text Data May feed a corpus of knowledge
that FM may use to answer questions through a chatbot interface FM may also be used to
normalized data formats Correct punctuation and grammar or handle low
confidence results that would normally be handled by a human these few use
cases are just the tip of the iceberg of what may be achieved by using
FMS let's revisit the IDP document workflow to see where FMS can add value
to the core IDP Technologies within the classification stage often times when comprehend
returns a low confidence result a human is required to manually classify the
document instead of interrupting a person to review the document FMS may be
used to classify the document in the extract and enrichment stage FMS may be
used to summarize document text normalize outputs for example formatting
all dates in monthmonth DayDay yearyear format or provide a natural language
chatbot interface to interact with the document data in the verification and human
review stage humans may use FMS along with Amazon Kendra the AWS Enterprise
search service to help verify the final
output at AWS security is top Priority Access Control is managed
through the awsam service and data confidentiality is maintained through encryption both at
rest and in transit Amazon vpcs or virtual private Cloud provides a
logically isolated Network to deploy your workloads an AWS provides services
that en enable our customers to meet their governance risk and compliance requirements AWS customers May check the
compliance status of each service to determine if it meets their compliance needs for example Amazon textract is in
scope for ISO 2701 sock and hippoc
compliance in the following demo we will see how IDP can help optimize insurance

the claim while the specific business rules and documents would differ the overall flow is similar for other use
cases such as quoting new business or handling dispute or resolutions using
the same underlying AWS aai Technologies this demo walks through the

humans would use dashboards and provide human in the loop judgment as required by the business roles and this
functionality can be integrated into your existing workflows and Asian
tools one of the benefits of IDP is the ability to handle easy yes or easy no
decisions based on the customer's business rules humans or other Advanced
decision systems can be used to handle complex decisions over time the share of
decisions made by automation can be increased one of the biggest challenges
faced in document processing is ensuring all of the required documents are included in the claim file looking at
the third claim you can see the claim didn't have the required documents and the customer was notified that they need
to upload the correct documents in order to repr process the claim quickly alerting customers to the need for more
documentation reduces the overall time it takes to get their claim paid the
